1: <sup>1</sup> Praise ye the LORD. Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.
2: <sup>2</sup> Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
3: <sup>3</sup> Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.
4: <sup>4</sup> For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.
5: <sup>5</sup> Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.
6: <sup>6</sup> Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;
7: <sup>7</sup> To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;
8: <sup>8</sup> To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;
9: <sup>9</sup> To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the LORD.
